column4: did someone already updated php from 5.3.2 to 5.4.3 on ubuntu? is it simple? and do we have to reinstall all the extensions as well (apc, memcache, ...) ?
I'm not aware of a 5.4.3 update
it was released a few days ago
released where ?
i don't know I just saw on php.net
right, so that isn't an ubuntu pacakge, there is no ubuntu apckage
use what ubuntu offers you and don't worry about it
then use 5.3.2
but it's very old, I can't believe there is no way to upgrade to a new version, even if it's not 5.4
why do you want to upgrade ?
what do you want that's not in the version you have ?
no particular reason just to be up to date
then don't
the ubuntu guys are offering you the package that is best suited for the version of the OS and components you are running - use what they offer you
apt-get install package, if it's installed it will say "package already installed"
but I don't want to install it, just check if it's here
dpkg -l | grep package
ok it looks good thanks, but I don't understand why? it says dpkg is for debian packages, and I've never used it, how can it know wich packages are installed? apt-get and dpkg are the same?
dpkg is the package manager for the "deb" package format used for both ubuntu and debian
apt-get is an interface or "hook" into dpkg
ok, but what shorcuts apt-get brings to us? the short name packages instead of the whole deb url?
it doesn't give shortcuts
